results.title: 'Murder ahoy'
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Lawrence P. Bachmann and George Pollock
results.brief_description: A sea-going whodunit where the intrepid Miss Marple finds herself investigating events on the HMS Battledore, a navy training ship designed to give young hoodlums a chance at new lives. Miss Marple discovers some-one is training the delinquents to be good thieves instead of good citizens and is willing to kill to keep the fact quiet! Murder Ahoy features a rogues gallery of suspects and ingenious means of despatching victims including strychnine-laced snuff, a poisoned mousetrap and a noose from a yard-arm. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Lionel Jeffries and Stringer Davis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Lawrence P. Bachmann and George Pollock

results.title: 'M' [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Nero-Film, Seymour Nebenzal and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: Peter Lorre in his greatest role portrays a psychotic child molester - a pathetic vagabond figure who experiences a frenzy at the sight of tender young school girls, and try as he may, he is unable to control the fervour of his criminal inclinations. The police disregard his letters of confession to them as the work of a lunatic, leaving the underworld to take the law into their own hands. The stylised realism of the sets and the detachment with which the opposing forces of law and outlawry are portrayed place this now classic film within the ambit of the so-called ‘new objectivity’ which was a reaction in Germany to the expressionist movement. This version is the longest available.

results.title: Mozzie
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jane Keneally and Dylan Yeo
results.brief_description: Spectacular animation about fluorocarbons, global warming and radical brain surgery. An evil entrepreneur discovers the real price of his actions. Combined live action and computer animation. Written, directed and animated by Dylan Yeo. Original format 35mm/colour.

results.title: The Watchers
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Cath Moore, Joe Weatherstone and Steven McGregor
results.brief_description: In a world where all our desires are monitored, a teenage boy is inspired to cross the line. But The Watchers are out and they show him where his actions may lead. Cast: Wayne Pygram, Dane Sheddon, Nathaniel Dean, Wayne Blair. 35mm live action footage with digital effects created on SGI, Mac and PC. Original format 35 mm/colour.

results.title: Great falls
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Libby Porter and Yves Stening
results.brief_description:
Jackie and his father return from a duck shooting trip to find his mother preparing to leave home with a young Air Force officer. She tells Jackie that she wants “a less domestic life”. Jackie doesn’t really understand what has happened but he knows that these things do happen and that life goes on somehow. “… I thought to myself that my life had turned … it was something that happened
to you - I knew that - and it happened to me in this way now.” Based on the short story by Richard Ford.

to you - I knew that - and it happened to me in this way now.” Based on the short story by Richard Ford.

results.title: Zipper: great moments in art and fashion
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Live action, choreography, animation and painting combine in a breathless trip through 20th century images in art and fashion - as you may not have seen them before. Voiceover presented by Arthur Dignam.
